title: Ticket #179: Condor-G double queue code better, but still not optimal
description:
Igor tested the new build given by Todd with thousands of condor-g jobs.

The results are better than before, but still not what they should be.

If you look at the attachments *_status.png you will see that new glideins begin to start around the 500 mark... sort of independent from how much time I had anything in the queue (the wait graph is "Unsubmitted" in condor speak).

BTW: I have GRIDMANAGER_MAX_PENDING_SUBMITS_PER_RESOURCE=500 GRIDMANAGER_MAX_PENDING_REQUESTS=500

This is still better than before, when they were starting close to the 0 mark, but still not what it should be!

PS: The attached *_log.png shows that terminations and startups are going on in parallel.

Image fnal3_status.png Image ucsd_status.png Image fnal2_status.png Image fnal2_log.png
remarks:
2009-Feb-17 12:21:21 by jfrey:
This turned out to be a problem with config parameter GRIDMANAGER_MAX_PENDING_SUBMITS_PER_RESOURCE. For the split throttle of GRIDMANAGER_MAX_JOBMANAGERS_PER_RESOURCE to work properly, GRIDMANAGER_MAX_PENDING_SUBMITS_PER_RESOURCE must be effectively set to infinity. See #207 for details.
